reviews.text: Outside of being one of the greatest animated films of its generation, it’s got a delightful sense of humor.
reviews.author: Cory Woodroof

reviews.text: Pixar's Finding Nemo elevated their already visionary and pioneering output to the thematic level of Hayao Miyazaki.
reviews.author: Brian Eggert

reviews.text: Easily Pixar's most colorful and joyous movie.
reviews.author: Kip Mooney

reviews.text: Finding Nemo teaches the classic Pixar/Disney lessons about the importance of family, acceptance, kindness, and love, but it also an exciting tale of adventure, overcoming adversity, and teamwork.
reviews.author: Sarah Brinks

reviews.text: In its story, characters, and visuals, Finding Nemo reminds us of how remarkable- and poignant- a well made family film can be.
reviews.author: Tyler Smith

reviews.text: The visuals are as sharp as the scripting, succeeding with laughs, thrills, heartache, and unforgettable characterizations to craft an animated masterpiece.
reviews.author: Mike Massie

reviews.text: Compared to other Pixar films, this may not be as good as the Toy Story franchise, but it's awfully close.
reviews.author: Micheal Compton

reviews.text: A family film that is truly for the whole family - from grandpop to grandson. Finding Nemo is a precious gem in the Pixar and Disney vaults. Exquisitely stunning, enchanting and magical from start to finish.
reviews.author: Debbie Lynn Elias

reviews.text: It's downright curmudgeonly to remain focused on the negatives when the rest of the picture is saturated with invention and wit.
reviews.author: Matt Brunson

reviews.text: Pixar really knocked it out of the park on this one.
reviews.author: Rachel Wagner

reviews.text: Most of all, Finding Nemo is a touching tale which reassures you that even though things may look bleak, it will all turn out well in the end.
reviews.author: Namrata Joshi

reviews.text: Finding Nemo offers as much in terms of thrills, frights, humour and psychological insight as it does in pure technical skill, proving that a movie can be art without being an "art" movie.
reviews.author: Neil Norman

reviews.text: This gem of a film is the one with which Pixar asserted their supremacy over the animated world.
reviews.author: Yasmin Shehab

reviews.text: ...a good-but-hardly-great animated endeavor from Pixar.
reviews.author: David Nusair

reviews.text: Finding Nemo is ultimately a rewarding, engaging, compelling, and even spiritual adventure that works charismatically on multiple levels.
reviews.author: Glen Oliver

reviews.text: It looks great, of course: All the Pixar movies do. But the genius of those other movies lay in their actual stories -- stories as inspired as the animation.
reviews.author: Matt Soergel

reviews.text: Visually, Finding Nemo is spectacular. The animators render theses scenes with exquisite detail and vibrant color, reaching beyond mere CGI-wizardry to artistry.
reviews.author: Tim Regan-Porter

reviews.text: A beguiling piece of storytelling and creates a magical underwater world through its imaginative graphics and sound effects.
reviews.author: Philip French

reviews.text: Artistically, it's up there with the all-time animated greats.
reviews.author: Christopher Tookey

reviews.text: A splendid eco-friendly comedy set in the Great Barrier Reef.
reviews.author: Sukhdev Sandhu

reviews.text: The animation in Finding Nemo is quite breathtaking and this movie, created by Pixar, the same outfit that made Toy Story, looks like The Undersea World of Jacques Cousteau.
reviews.author: Philip Kerr

reviews.text: The tropical pleasure is a beautifully imagined adventure that beguiles children and tickles adults.
reviews.author: James Christopher

reviews.text: A spectacular comedy-adventure that's never less than totally immersive. Not quite the masterpiece that Toy Story was, but it's the closest Pixar have come since.
reviews.author: Kevin Harley

reviews.text: Finding Nemo is a wonderment, certainly not human, yet humorously humane.
reviews.author: Steve Persall

reviews.text: A lavish feast and the best family catch of the summer blockbuster season.
reviews.author: Dennis King

reviews.text: Finding Nemo is distributed by Disney, and it has what the most heartfelt Disney animated features used to have: rapturous imagery matched with real wit.
reviews.author: Peter Rainer

reviews.text: Deliriously inventive and soaked in a warm and generous wit.
reviews.author: Mike Goodridge

reviews.text: Pixar's turned in an instant classic.
reviews.author: Joel Siegel

reviews.text: Pixar's fourth feature for Disney is yet another miracle of computer animation, an instant classic, but with less of the surface brightness of Toy Story or Monsters, Inc.
reviews.author: Leah Rozen

reviews.text: Pixar continued its run of superb computer-generated animated features with this jaw-dropping underwater adventure.
reviews.author: Sloan Freer

reviews.text: [Dory's] throwaway lines are funnier than anything that comes out of all the other fish combined, balancing out the dull father-son-must-be-reunited story at the core of Nemo that threatens to make this just another cartoon.
reviews.author: Erin Podolsky

reviews.text: The latest flood of wizardry from Pixar, whose productions, from Toy Story onward, have lent an indispensable vigor and wit to the sagging art of mainstream animation.
reviews.author: Anthony Lane

reviews.text: Finding Nemo is laced with smart humor and clever gags, and buoyed by another cheery story of mismatched buddies: a pair of fish voiced by Albert Brooks and Ellen DeGeneres.
reviews.author: David Germain

reviews.text: Like Pixar's previous films, Finding Nemo mines humor from the oddities of an unknown world but stays grounded in a familiar one, finding recognizable elements of heartbreak and happiness amid the ink-jetting octopi and irritable flounders.
reviews.author: Keith Phipps

reviews.text: While Mr. Brooks is very funny, Ms. DeGeneres gives a bravura comic performance, as well as a touching one.
reviews.author: Joe Morgenstern

reviews.text: The animation is so sleek and the action so perfectly paced that even the sharpest viewer could be forgiven for overlooking some unimportant lapses in internal logic.
reviews.author: Donald Clarke

reviews.text: It looks more stunning than ever.
reviews.author: Derek Malcolm

reviews.text: An Easter treat.
reviews.author: Allan Hunter

reviews.text: This is a classic - bring on the sequel!
reviews.author: Lewis Bazley

reviews.text: Every frond and fin pokes out at you.
reviews.author: Tim Robey

reviews.text: Re-releasing Nemo in 3D gives a whole new generation the chance to enjoy it in cinemas for the first time - as well as adding extra depth to the wonderful scenes from the ocean deep.
reviews.author: Graham Young

reviews.text: Though some scary parts may make the very young fret unduly, the film also puts forward some thoughtful messages for both children and their parents. [Blu-ray 3D]
reviews.author: Peter Canavese

reviews.text: Detail is what holds your attention from frame to frame: the panorama of soft and hard corals, the different textured sea bottoms, the undulating seaweed, and the schooling sardines that look flashy and real as can be.
reviews.author: James Plath

reviews.text: I don't exactly worship Pixar, but "Finding Nemo" is truly a great film.
reviews.author: Paul Chambers

reviews.text: Gill is Platoon's Sgt. Elias if he'd survived Sgt. Barnes' treachery and returned to civilian life weary and hard-bitten from his experiences. And also a fish.
reviews.author: Pete Vonder Haar

reviews.text: Finding Nemo 3D is a quality post-conversion experience that successfully enhances the 2003 film's original standout visuals.
reviews.author: Ben Kendrick

reviews.text: The 3D gives the images a little more depth but they already had heft and weight. The 3D is a money-making gimmick, nothing more.
reviews.author: Marshall Fine

reviews.text: A great blend of storytelling and technology.
reviews.author: John Wirt

reviews.text: It's bright, it's beautiful and it hasn't aged a day. So why, then, do we need to see it in 3-D?
reviews.author: Rob Vaux

reviews.text: A rare example of a movie that not only survives its 3-D conversion but benefits from it
reviews.author: Mike Scott

reviews.text: It was as funny as I remember and brilliant because it is subtle. It just knocks it out of the park. I love everything about this movie, one of my favorite Pixar movies of all time, 5/5 Schmoes. The new sound/3D adds to the greatness that is Nemo.
reviews.author: Kristian Harloff

reviews.text: If you're fishing for fun in an ocean of movie mediocrity, grab the kids or the grandkids, fork out a few extra bucks and see this one in three-dimensions.
reviews.author: Gary Wolcott

reviews.text: It's a great movie, so much fun, an acheivement that should be enjoyed by children of all ages and worth seeing it in 3D.
reviews.author: Mark Ellis

reviews.text: Sea-worthy w/enhanced visual lure and rich, humorous characters set in a double narrative; this 3D revisit allows us to fall overboard all over again.
reviews.author: Kimberly Gadette

reviews.text: If ever there was a film that wasn't broke, this is it. So naturally they converted it into 3D for a special re-release this weekend. (Stupid irony.)
reviews.author: William Bibbiani

reviews.text: A timeless delight.
reviews.author: Elizabeth Weitzman

reviews.text: I believe my sensitivity to certain creative choices of the picture has dulled some, while age has opened my eyes to its complex relationships and tireless sense of exploration.
reviews.author: Brian Orndorf

reviews.text: When the blunt head of Bruce the shark slams into the screen like a hammer, everyone -- adults included -- gasps
reviews.author: Amy Nicholson

reviews.text: At its best, the added dimension is merely harmless, making the movie blurry enough that you need special glasses to make it sharp again.
reviews.author: Jaime N. Christley

reviews.text: [VIDEO ESSAY] Disney/Pixar's 3D upgrade of its classic animated children's movie - using the expensive Xpand 3D format - has the duel effect of darkening the film's vibrant colors while adding considerable depth to the screen.
reviews.author: Cole Smithey

reviews.text: If the Pixar vault was on fire and they could only save one film, it'd be this eminently re-watchable modern fairy tale...Looks all the more stunning with this state-of-the-art 3D retro-fit.
reviews.author: Jim Schembri

reviews.text: I could write an entire dissertation on how much I love this movie.
reviews.author: Liam Maguren

reviews.text: Not worth the trip to the cinema but is worth every cent as a home entertainment blu ray purchase.
reviews.author: Blake Howard

reviews.text: Sweet father-son tale with some very scary moments.
reviews.author: Nell Minow

reviews.text: Tremendously well-made, marshaling the techniques of live-action filmmaking better than any CGI feature up to that point ever had.
reviews.author: Tim Brayton

reviews.text: In this seamless blending of technical brilliance and storytelling verve, the Pixar team has made something as marvelously soulful and innately, fluidly American as jazz.
reviews.author: Lisa Schwarzbaum

reviews.text: A dynamic and entertaining film for all ages...
reviews.author: Felix Vasquez Jr.

reviews.text: Wonderful writing generates several layers of humour -- from the innocent joys of childish fun to more complex comedy, but never at anyone's (or any fish's) cruel expense -- as well as an engaging dramatic plot.
reviews.author: Urban Cinefile Critics

reviews.text: Nemo, with its ravishing underwater fantasia, manages to trump the design glamour of earlier Pixar films.
reviews.author: Richard Corliss

reviews.text: Very clever and imaginative indeed.
reviews.author: Todd McCarthy

reviews.text: [An] aquatic joyride.
reviews.author: Ted Shen

reviews.text: A visual marvel, every frame packed to the gills with clever details, Finding Nemo is the best big-studio release so far this year.
reviews.author: David Ansen

reviews.text: Terrific-looking and sweet, it's certainly up to the superior standard Pixar has set for prime family entertainment.
reviews.author: Angie Errigo

reviews.text: I was swept up in its dazzling stream of rainbow corals, amused by the stoner turtles going with the flow, sharks battling their own regressive instincts and DeGeneres' scatterbrained Dory.
a good family film
reviews.author: Kevin Carr

reviews.text: Magical. God knows how they do it, but Pixar is easily the most consistent, most intelligent movie shop in Hollywood.
reviews.author: David Medsker

reviews.text: A joyous delight for audiences of all ages.
reviews.author: Ethan Alter

reviews.text: Enthralling, and gorgeous, from start to finish.
reviews.author: Jeffrey Overstreet

reviews.text: Brilliantly conceived Pixar movie is loaded with family values, albeit the salt water variety.
reviews.author: Steve Crum

reviews.text: A fish tale the whole family can enjoy.
reviews.author: Mark Sells

reviews.text: The creators are cracking themselves up first, the way the Warner Bros. animators did in Bugs Bunny's golden age; it works for anyone with a sense of humor.
reviews.author: Jake Euker

reviews.text: Finding Nemo is a triumph, with a different, richer feel than any previous Pixar film. Aided by a smart, evocative score by Thomas Newman, the story is funny, moving and completely engrossing.
reviews.author: Edward Johnson-Ott

reviews.text: Fantastic animation, a great cast, and hilarious laughs make Finding Nemo a must see movie for the summer.
reviews.author: Scott Chitwood

reviews.text: '... excellent storytelling with superb, eye-popping animation...'
reviews.author: Lori Hoffman

reviews.text: Click to read review
reviews.author: Michael Dequina

reviews.text: It's all tremendously entertaining stuff, with oodles of wonderful detail and superb direction by Andrew Stanton.
reviews.author: Peter Bradshaw

reviews.text: As the voice of the forgetful Dory, Ellen DeGeneres shows us how Memento could have been a comedy in this entertaining and visually stunning family flick.
reviews.author: Andrew Manning

reviews.text: Each obstacle is a fabulous set piece with not-always-obvious lessons to be learned and smart, original humor.
reviews.author: Mark Robison

reviews.text: If it's not quite a tidal wave of entertainment, it's a welcome dip in the ocean nonetheless.
reviews.author: Daniel M. Kimmel

reviews.text: Debutant writer-director Andrew Stanton, crams the feel-good fable with wondrous visuals while ensuring that the life lessons are schmaltz-free.
reviews.author: Rashid Irani

reviews.text: It's all beautiful, all right. But before long I began to feel beaten against the rocks of that beauty -- Finding Nemo smacks of looky-what-I-can-do virtuosity, and after the first 10 minutes or so, it's exhausting.
reviews.author: Stephanie Zacharek

reviews.text: It's a whale of a tale that's well worth catching. Even if fish isn't usually your dish.
reviews.author: Carol Cling

reviews.text: The best father-son story in all of Hollywood animation, and maybe animation generally...exploits the potential of computer animation like no film before it and few films after it.
reviews.author: Steven D. Greydanus

reviews.text: This stonking film is a perfect example of Total Cinema, combining tragedy, excitement and humour, all wrapped up in one amazing looking package.
reviews.author: Ed Colley

reviews.text: Enchanting, heartwarming and terrifically made.
reviews.author: Chitra Mahesh

reviews.text: Finding Nemo may be the most beautiful and detailed animated movie ever made.
reviews.author: John J. Puccio

reviews.text: 'Like a road movie, only wetter.'
reviews.author: Paul Arendt

reviews.text: Ellen Degenerous and Albert Brooks lend their voices to the craziest fish ever to talk on screen, and Dame Edna (Barry Humphries) performs a turn as a vegetarian shark!
reviews.author: David Foucher

reviews.text: Fin-tastic -- hilarious, moving and beautiful to look at, this is another instant classic.
reviews.author: Matthew Turner

reviews.text: Every single frame of the film is rendered with such detail and warmth that even without a compelling plot it would be a joy to watch.
reviews.author: Josh Bell

reviews.text: This is not the first time Pixar's animators have been engaged with the natural world, but they've never been as deeply immersed as they are in this undersea Fantasia.
reviews.author: Sandra Hall

reviews.text: Is this kid's stuff? That's a complicated question but the answer is a thing of beauty that will have children enchanted hook, line and sinker.
reviews.author: Shannon J. Harvey

reviews.text: There are so many subtle jokes, or little bits of insight into these fish's minds, it proves yet again that Pixar strives to make a complete experience instead of just 'some cool-looking graphics.'
reviews.author: Shawn Bowers

reviews.text: There are 3.7 trillion ideas in Hollywood for an animated film; Disney and Pixar have found another one audiences won't be able to resist.
reviews.author: Kevin A. Ranson

reviews.text: Finding Nemo will please audiences of all ages with its raucous spirit and outrageous moments.
reviews.author: Wesley Lovell

reviews.text: There is beauty and brilliance in every frame.
reviews.author: Nev Pierce

reviews.text: La originalidad de sus universos y personajes, lo disparatado y divertido de sus situaciones, la inteligencia de muchos dilogos, y la reconocible humanidad con que los animadores visten a sus criaturas, son los principales ingredientes que contribuyen a
reviews.author: Enrique Buchichio

reviews.text: It was one of those instances where I found myself recounting out loud the funniest moments to someone who just saw the movie with me.
reviews.author: Michael Drakulich

reviews.text: A expressividade dos personagens  tamanha que os dilogos tornam-se at mesmo dispensveis.
reviews.author: Pablo Villaça

reviews.text: For obvious reasons (no toys!), this feels like a much more grown-up film than previous Disney-Pixar movies.
reviews.author: Rich Cline

reviews.text: Crafted with such care that the story, characters and colours positively pulsate.
reviews.author: Kim Linekin

reviews.text: 'Entraable, divertida y profundamente humana, es una obra de arte imprescindible.'
reviews.author: Jorge Avila Andrade

reviews.text: You know exactly how this one ends; yet getting there is such an enjoyable delight.
reviews.author: Tom Meek

reviews.text: Beats any Disney animated film through 1960 and probably a good deal later.
reviews.author: Mark R. Leeper

reviews.text: Finding Nemo might just be [Pixar's] best effort yet.
reviews.author: Sara Michelle Fetters

reviews.text: This movie reaffirmed my love for the cinema.
reviews.author: Matt Easterbrook

reviews.text: It's the brilliant animation and witty script that lift this film from retread material to sublime entertainment for kids and - equally - their parents.
reviews.author: Brian Webster

reviews.text: Pixar's masterpiece. It feels dizzy with color and drunk on its own otherworldly creation. Sure, it derives most of its splendor from what actually exists on our ocean floors, but that doesn't make it any less wondrous.
reviews.author: Collin Souter

reviews.text: Each frame of Finding Nemo is a visual delight.
reviews.author: James Kendrick

reviews.text: [Once again Pixar] ensures that the label 'family film' isn't 'a movie only your tots will enjoy' but something that actually is for everyone.
reviews.author: Ryan Cracknell

reviews.text: "Finding Nemo" was funny and a little scary, at least for the little tykes.
reviews.author: Dan Marcucci and Nancy Serougi

reviews.text: The amazing thing about Pixar is that in every film, I go in with incredibly high, unrealistic expectations, & they always excel beyond them.
reviews.author: Karina Montgomery

reviews.text: Simply the most entertaining movie you'll see all year.
reviews.author: Garth Franklin

reviews.text: I don't know how the staff of Pixar does it, but this is their fifth overwhelming achievement in a row.
reviews.author: Mark Dujsik

reviews.text: A clown fish without a punchline, a blue tang without a memory, a scarred prison hero fish, and a stoner dude sea turtle make for this summer's tallest fish tale.
reviews.author: Jeet Thayil

reviews.text: ...the movie is chock-full of color and fun, ambitiously gliding through one vibrant scene after another as it reveals an engaging and beautiful world...
reviews.author: David Keyes

reviews.text: Like Toy Story, A Bug's Life, and Monster's Inc., it features amazing animation, great characters, sharp wit, smart humor, and a story both timeless and timely.
reviews.author: Renie Scolaro Mora

reviews.text: An enchanting animated feature.
reviews.author: Jami Bernard

reviews.text: Latest computer-animated offering from Pixar is a giant leap forward visually, even if the story treads familiar ground ... uh, water.
reviews.author: James Rocchi

reviews.text: Although Finding Nemo reaches a new watermark in animation, it doesn't have the endearing characters or driving plot of Toy Story and Monsters, Inc. But then, classics are tough acts to follow.
reviews.author: Susan Tavernetti

reviews.text: ...Finding Nemo" captures the audience with vastly touching characters the audience really cares about.
reviews.author: Tony Toscano

reviews.text: A thing of beauty, hugely entertaining and way cool.
reviews.author: Peter Travers

reviews.text: The artwork is gorgeous and the characters are strong.
reviews.author: Robert Roten

reviews.text: Another extraordinary effort from the unbeatable Disney/Pixar team.
reviews.author: Audrey Rock-Richardson

reviews.text: The animation team gives weight and depth to the sea itself, filling it with specks of life and creating a sense of movement with currents and bubbles.
reviews.author: Massimo Commanducci

reviews.text: The junior set will most definitely enjoy the jokes and the yarn, but it will be the adults who learn the biggest lessons this time around.
reviews.author: Charlie Brown

reviews.text: The peerless partnership of Disney and Pixar is officially five-for-five.
reviews.author: Jonathan R. Perry

reviews.text: Pixar respects both kids and parents-which cannot be said for certain big green ogres of animation.
reviews.author: Stephen Himes

reviews.text: Several scenes are scarier than Edward Norton's mustache in "The Italian Job."
reviews.author: Beth Jones

reviews.text: The latest feature from Pixar Animation is another splendid, eye-filling installment in the studio's unbroken string of classics.
reviews.author: Jim Lane

reviews.text: More than just high calorie viscera, Finding Nemo is the best American comedy in two years.
reviews.author: Mark Palermo

reviews.text: Finding Nemo is undoubtedly another jewel in the Pixar crown and another example of the Disney conglomerate's ability to ride that company's coattails to success.
reviews.author: John R. McEwen

reviews.text: "Finding Nemo" is a whale of a treat.
reviews.author: Linda Cook

reviews.text: Finding Nemo captures a level of wonderment and dark sentiment unmatched even by the previous great works of Pixar. Walt Disney's throne is very much at risk.
reviews.author: Jimmy O

reviews.text: Winning, invigorating entertainment for the entire family -- technically brilliant, attentive to detail, and precisely tuned between story and character.
reviews.author: Brent Simon

reviews.text: Proof that Pixar is the Babe Ruth of animation. Still batting a thousand.
reviews.author: Eric Lurio

reviews.text: Finding Nemo is terrific entertainment.
reviews.author: Richard Roeper

reviews.text: . . . the computer animation reimaginings of the undersea orgies of color orchestrated by nature are mind-blowing.
reviews.author: Glenn Kenny

reviews.text: C'mon, it's Pixar. Would you expect anything less than perfection?
reviews.author: Elias Savada

reviews.text: Visually stunning but dragged down somewhat by insipid dialogue.
reviews.author: Harvey S. Karten

reviews.text: There's real heart in this movie without needing lots of superficial whiz-bang stuff.
reviews.author: Mike McGranaghan

reviews.text: Continually floods the viewer with more extraordinary sensory input than anything previously.
reviews.author: Marc Savlov

reviews.text: Colorful and entertaining for kids and witty enough to engage adults.
reviews.author: Annlee Ellingson

reviews.text: I have never been to Australia, but I just can't imagine scenery more beautiful.
reviews.author: Danny Minton

reviews.text: Fast, funny and brackisly beautiful.
reviews.author: Boo Allen

reviews.text: If Pixar was fishing for another big catch in their stable of entertaining hits, Nemo is the prized filmmaking flounder that takes the absolute bait.
reviews.author: Frank Ochieng

reviews.text: The plot is delightful, the animation spectacular ... the colors gorgeous, the message positive and the score by Thomas Newman fitting.
reviews.author: Jean Lowerison

reviews.text: A gem of a movie, and exactly what we expect from our friends at Pixar.
reviews.author: Eric D. Snider

reviews.text: It turns out that Pixar does fish like nobody does fish.
reviews.author: David Edelstein

reviews.text: Finding Nemo is superlative family entertainment, joyous and alive in a way few films are.
reviews.author: Dustin Putman

reviews.text: ..the computer animated imagery is once again exquisite... The bad side, the story line is only pleasant.
reviews.author: Josh Gilchrist

reviews.text: The computer graphics create a visual world that you would actually see if you dived down 50 feet on a coral reef
reviews.author: Robin Clifford

reviews.text: With its phenomenal animation and heart-warming story, Finding Nemo is a resounding hit with this daddy-daughter combo.
reviews.author: Matt Norris

reviews.text: My fondest wish is that Pixar doesn't hire or fire anyone for the next 25 years. What these magicians are capable of is nothing less than pure cinematic gold.
reviews.author: Scott Weinberg

reviews.text: A hundred different little moments constantly impress either with their use of movement and light or their use of stillness and darkness.
reviews.author: Jeffrey M. Anderson

reviews.text: far more sophisticated and ambitious than what typically passes for 'family entertainment.' ...manages to be extremely funny, thrilling and sometimes a little scary as well.
reviews.author: James Sanford

reviews.text: As notable for its well-crafted story as it is for its breathtaking animation.
reviews.author: Dan Fazio

reviews.text: A captivating and richly resonant aquatic fable, with characters whose gills and fins belie their deliciously human (that is, flawed) personalities.
reviews.author: Michael O'Sullivan

reviews.text: Finding Nemo will engross kids with its absorbing story, brightly drawn characters and lively action, and grown-ups will be equally entertained by the film's subtle humor and the sophistication of its visuals.
reviews.author: Ann Hornaday

reviews.text: The visuals pop, the fish emote and the ocean comes alive. That's in the first two minutes. After that, they do some really cool stuff.
reviews.author: C.W. Nevius

reviews.text: In not just a crowd-grabber but an instant classic, Albert Brooks achieves a new height vocally as Marlin, the dad.
reviews.author: David Elliott

reviews.text: DeGeneres does vocal duties by which all future voiceovers and dubs will be judged.
reviews.author: Joe Baltake

reviews.text: Strikes the perfect balance between the charm and childlike innocence of Disney animation and the cutting-edge humor and hipness of the old Warner Brothers cartoons.
reviews.author: Jack Garner

reviews.text: On its visual elements alone, Finding Nemo could get almost any kid started on a love of nature -- even if us older specimens know that it's a deep understanding of human nature that keeps the whole thing swimming.
reviews.author: Steve Schneider

reviews.text: More familiar in its story line and characters than previous Pixar films, it's nevertheless stuffed with wit, energy, charm and clever touches.
reviews.author: Shawn Levy

reviews.text: A captivating little adventure that gives its animated characters as much heart as personality and that's a heaping helping in both cases.
reviews.author: Louis B. Hobson

reviews.text: PIxar's fifth feature-length film continues an uninterrupted string of winners; and from a visual standpoint, it's the studio's finest effort.
reviews.author: Forrest Hartman

reviews.text: Even though Finding Nemo isn't Pixar's best, this animated comedy-adventure is still more imaginative and more clever in any five of its 100 minutes than most films manage in a full 90 minutes... or 120, for that matter.
reviews.author: Jeff Vice

reviews.text: An exquisitely touching saga about a father tracking down his lost son.
reviews.author: Lisa Kennedy

reviews.text: One of those rare movies where I wanted to sit in the front row and let the images wash out to the edges of my field of vision.
reviews.author: Roger Ebert

reviews.text: Finding Nemo isn't quite up there with the company's finest work -- there's finally a sense of formula setting in -- but it's hands down the best family film since Monsters, Inc.
reviews.author: Ty Burr

reviews.text: For a computer-generated cartoon to provoke laughs, thrills and a few tears, that's not just a great movie -- that's perfection in pixels.
reviews.author: Sean P. Means

reviews.text: What's unique and joyous is that it creates a whirl of slapstick and sentiment all its own, in an environment so otherworldly and beautiful that leaving the theater will give you the bends.
reviews.author: Michael Sragow

reviews.text: Absolutely beautiful to look at, even when it has a bad case of the cutes.
reviews.author: Bill Gallo

reviews.text: I really can't remember an animated feature in which the voice work sounded so accomplished, redolent with emotional subtleties and crack comic timing.
reviews.author: Bob Strauss

reviews.text: A superb animated film.
reviews.author: Ray Conlogue

reviews.text: A vivid charmer of a movie that makes a welcome addition to the growing gallery of computer-generated animated features.
reviews.author: Robert Denerstein

reviews.text: Add water and you have an instant Disney/Pixar classic.
reviews.author: Paul Clinton (CNN.com)

reviews.text: Pixar is so consistent that reviews of their films basically write themselves. Finding Nemo is greatness!
reviews.author: John Venable

reviews.text: Just when you thought they couldn't possibly do it again, the guys at Pixar bat it out of the park with Finding Nemo.
reviews.author: Kit Bowen

reviews.text: What a catch - this whopper of a fish tale takes you beyond the sea.
reviews.author: Cherryl Dawson and Leigh Ann Palone

reviews.text: A gem, popping with cool tropical colors and wondrous sea creatures.
reviews.author: Scott Von Doviak

reviews.text: The moment all the gorgeously rendered inhabitants of this beautiful undersea realm open their mouths, they sound surprisingly, and rather depressingly, human.
reviews.author: MaryAnn Johanson

reviews.text: One of the strongest releases from Disney in years, thanks to the work of Andrew Stanton, possibly one of the most successful directors you've never heard of.
reviews.author: Daphne Gordon

reviews.text: Enchanting; written with an effortless blend of sweetness and silliness, and animated with such rainbow-hued beauty, you may find yourself wanting to freeze-frame it.
reviews.author: Moira MacDonald

reviews.text: A near perfect example of movie magic that will appeal to viewers of all ages.
reviews.author: Jim Judy

reviews.text: It's business as usual -- the usual being stunning visuals, a charming story, and a dab of emotional resonance thrown in for good measure.
reviews.author: Gary Thompson

reviews.text: Constantly delights and refreshes the eye -- it's a summer vacation in itself.
reviews.author: Bob Campbell

reviews.text: A dazzling, computer-animated fish tale with a funny, touching script and wonderful voice performances that make it an unqualified treat for all ages.
reviews.author: Lou Lumenick

reviews.text: Once again, the team at Pixar proves that the freshest, most entertaining films coming out of Hollywood today are the animated kind.
reviews.author: Joe Lozito

reviews.text: As with all of Pixar's earlier efforts, the animation in this movie is superb. They just keep getting better.
reviews.author: Scott Nash

reviews.text: A simple test of humanity: If you don't laugh aloud while watching it, you've got a battery not a heart.
reviews.author: Tom Long

reviews.text: The creatures in Finding Nemo are more real than some flesh and blood actors.
reviews.author: Rebecca Murray

reviews.text: Those Pixar strengths -- story, humor, characters, and art ... shine through, more dependable than rising of the ocean tides.
reviews.author: Jeffrey Chen

reviews.text: Saying that Finding Nemo is Pixar's weakest effort to date is like a starving man telling you the third piece of pizza you've given him wasn't as good as the first.
reviews.author: Erik Childress

reviews.text: Isn't quite as clever and wonderful as we've come to expect. Even as such, it remains pretty clever and wonderful.
reviews.author: Eugene Novikov

reviews.text: Lives up to Pixar's high standards for wildly creative visuals, clever comedy, solid characters and an involving story.
reviews.author: Bruce Westbrook

reviews.text: Basically another winner, though it can't quite muster the kind of emotional tug that appeals to all generations and made several of the earlier Pixar films such instant classics.
reviews.author: William Arnold

reviews.text: Pixar has done it again.
reviews.author: Todd Anthony

reviews.text: Treats family audiences to a sweet, resonant story and breathtaking visuals.
reviews.author: Claudia Puig

reviews.text: As we now expect from Pixar, even the supporting fish in "Finding Nemo" are more developed as characters than any human in the Mission: Impossible movies.
reviews.author: Terry Lawson

reviews.text: So advanced - with lifelike motion and imagination-tingling artwork stroked with a silicon paintbrush - that it makes its predecessors come off as crude, ancient scrawlings on a cave wall.
reviews.author: Phil Villarreal

reviews.text: ...a parable for parents terrified at the thought of preschool.
reviews.author: Josh Larsen

reviews.text: Rarely matches the emotional depth or richly textured worlds of predecessors Monsters, Inc. and A Bug's Life, but it has a sly sense of humor and evocative voice acting.
reviews.author: Duane Dudek

reviews.text: Pixar heads under the sea and finds subject matter that couldn't be more perfectly suited to its vivid style of computer animation.
reviews.author: Angel Cohn

reviews.text: There may be plenty of fish in the sea (for now, anyway), but few films can manipulate you like Finding Nemo and have you not mind.
reviews.author: Tor Thorsen

reviews.text: Visual imagination and sophisticated wit raise Finding Nemo to a level just below the peaks of Pixar's Toy Story movies and Monsters, Inc..
reviews.author: Stephen Holden

reviews.text: Erupts with sea creatures that showcase Stanton and company's gift for character and peerless eye for skewering contemporary culture.
reviews.author: Kenneth Turan

reviews.text: A fish story that hooks you from the opening scene.
reviews.author: Bill Muller

reviews.text: Delivers with a colorful, lush and witty world under the sea.
reviews.author: Nancy Churnin

reviews.text: The best animated underwater picture since The Little Mermaid.
reviews.author: Gregory M. Lamb

reviews.text: As eye-popping as Nemo's peepers and as eccentric as this little fish with asymmetrical fins.
reviews.author: Carrie Rickey

reviews.text: Parental anxiety may not be the kind of stuff children's films are usually made of, but this perfectly enchanting movie knows how to cater to its kiddie audience without condescending to them.
reviews.author: Rene Rodriguez

reviews.text: Pixar's employees, masters of computer-generated animation, capture the look of the ocean like no artists before.
reviews.author: Lawrence Toppman

reviews.text: There wasn't one element I didn't love about this captivating movie.
reviews.author: Mary F. Pols

reviews.text: Fish, schmish. This is a movie about humanity, and I doubt if we'll see a more compelling father/son relationship this year.
reviews.author: Chris Hewitt

reviews.text: Spectacular visuals, non-stop laughs and action -- plus a PC message. That's some package, no?
reviews.author: Glenn Lovell

reviews.text: Pixar's super genius continues to flow with no ebb in sight.
reviews.author: Jeffrey Westhoff

reviews.text: Lives up to the proud, relatively new tradition of Monsters, Inc., A Bug's Life and the Toy Story films.
reviews.author: Jay Boyar

reviews.text: The underwater backdrops take your breath away. No, really. They're so lifelike, you almost feel like holding your breath while watching.
reviews.author: Gene Seymour

reviews.text: Proves that even when Pixar is not at the top of its game, it still produces better animation than some of its competitors on their best days.
reviews.author: Jeff Strickler

reviews.text: As gorgeous a film as Disney's ever put out, with astonishing qualities of light, movement, surface and color at the service of the best professional imaginations money can buy.
reviews.author: Hazel-Dawn Dumpert

reviews.text: A treasure trove of visual splendor.
reviews.author: James Berardinelli

reviews.text: You connect to these sea creatures as you rarely do with humans in big-screen adventures. The result: a true sunken treasure.
reviews.author: Mark Caro

reviews.text: It's full of bright visuals, inventive animation and enough cute characters to fill, well, an ocean.
reviews.author: Eleanor Ringel Cater

reviews.text: Finding Nemo is a witty and epic adventure packed in unlikely wrapping.
reviews.author: Rachel Deahl

reviews.text: Is Pixar capable of making a bad film? Whether a serendipitous confluence of talent or. . .some divine being at work in our world, either way, the answer, I think, must be no.
reviews.author: Andrea Chase

reviews.text: There's nothing fishy about its success. It's got intriguing anthropomorphic characters, a compelling story and Pixar's fanciful computer-generated animation. It's fun, bubbly, fantastic. Sea it!
reviews.author: Susan Granger

reviews.text: You won't need a map to unearth the treasures buried in Nemo.
reviews.author: Sean O'Connell

reviews.text: Thanks to a solid script by director Andrew Stanton (a Pixar regular), many of the human actors who give voices to the computer-generated fish wind up becoming more engaging than when they appear in flesh-and-blood.
reviews.author: Dan Lybarger

reviews.text: Unlike the greatest children's films, I never once forgot who the target market for Finding Nemo really was.
reviews.author: Steven Snyder

reviews.text: The concept of a fish with short-term memory loss sounded dubiously annoying, but DeGeneres just swims off with it
reviews.author: Laura Clifford

reviews.text: It's the give-and-take between DeGeneres and Brooks that gives the saga its big heart.
reviews.author: Sheri Linden

reviews.text: Children and adults alike should be enchanted...as quietly charming, cheekily amusing a family feature as you're likely to encounter this summer.
reviews.author: Frank Swietek

reviews.text: ... with Father's Day just a few weeks away...'Nemo' swims off with hearts of all ages.
reviews.author: John Urbancich

reviews.text: With the release of Finding Nemo, the creative team at Pixar has redefined what is known as being 'on a role.'
reviews.author: Alex Sandell

reviews.text: Further proof that the folks at Pixar are ceaselessly, unflaggingly more clever and imaginative than anyone else working in big-budget feature animation.
reviews.author: Rob Blackwelder

reviews.text: A rousing underwater adventure set in the Great Barrier Reef that celebrates youthful independence and lances the illusion that parents can make the world safe for their children.
reviews.author: Frederic and Mary Ann Brussat

reviews.text: It's an ocean of eye candy that tastes fresh even in this ADD-addled era of SpongeBob SquarePants.
reviews.author: Ed Park

reviews.text: Yet another quantum leap for the Pixar folk.
reviews.author: J. Robert Parks

reviews.text: I can't say that this movie was as exciting, original or captivating as many of its predecessors and would recommend it more to the toddlers.
reviews.author: JoBlo

reviews.text: A great film for its timeliness, and a greater film for its timelessness.
reviews.author: Walter Chaw

reviews.text: Pixar has interlaced its energetic storyline with the moody strains of a classic Thomas Newman score, lending an element of darkness that ingeniously penetrates the perpetual submarine light.
reviews.author: Jeanne Aufmuth

reviews.text: Finding Nemo is cute and clever, but it's no Toy Story, A Bug's Life or Monsters, Inc.
reviews.author: Steve Rhodes

reviews.text: Creates a very high benchmark for this summer's other films to strive to best, and I don't think any of them will.
reviews.author: Jon Popick

reviews.text: Could have been stronger, but it's still fun and has good heart. Ditto to what Steve Rhodes said.
reviews.author: Ross Anthony

reviews.text: Another masterful piece of family entertainment from Pixar.
reviews.author: Daniel Etherington

reviews.text: A wonderfully engaging entertainment that is a visual masterpiece as well as a darn good tale with loads of humour and excitement to appeal to the child in all of us.
reviews.author: Caffeinated Clint

reviews.text: Finding Nemo merely transplants human suburban anxiety to an underwater realm.
reviews.author: Ed Gonzalez

reviews.text: Another terrific Pixar pic for all generations.
reviews.author: Shirley Sealy

reviews.text: Finding Nemo is like a great foreign film, its visual and energy having such clarity that subtitles (or words or stories) are almost unnecessary.
reviews.author: David Poland

reviews.text: No doubt, Finding Nemo marks yet another huge advance in the world of animation. The technical term for these advances, in layman's language, is "Holy mackerel!"
reviews.author: Liz Braun

synopsis: Marlin (Albert Brooks), a clown fish, is overly cautious with his son, Nemo (Alexander Gould), who has a foreshortened fin. When Nemo swims too close to the surface to prove himself, he is caught by a diver, and horrified Marlin must set out to find him. A blue reef fish named Dory (Ellen DeGeneres) -- who has a really short memory -- joins Marlin and complicates the encounters with sharks, jellyfish, and a host of ocean dangers. Meanwhile, Nemo plots his escape from a dentist's fish tank.
